intro: Helicteres dumosa, commonly known as the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Helicteres dumosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
